definition: lit. one-track path; fig. to adopt a unified approach to discussing an issue/to sing from the same hymn-sheet
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls

sentences.english: And maintaining unified leadership by the Central Committee is interpreted as "doing everything according to unified standards".
sentences.chinese: 堅持中央的統一領導，變成了“一切統一口徑”。
